Policy: Commission Decision 2004/643/EC concerning the placing on the market, in accordance with Directive 2001/18/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council, of a maize product (Zea mays L. line NK603) genetically modified for glyphosate tolerance.
Policy_Content: According to Directive 2001/18/EC, the placing on the market of a product containing or consisting of a genetically modified organism or a combination of genetically modified organisms is subject to written consent being granted by the competent authority of Member States. Pursuant to the present Decision of the European Community Commission, the competent authority of Spain shall grant written consent to the placing on the market of grains of maize with increased tolerance to the herbicide glyphosate, derived from the transformation event specified under article 2. The product may be used as any other maize, except for cultivation and uses as or in food. It may be marketed only under the conditions defined in article 3.

Policy: Loi concernant l’aménagement communal et le développement urbain.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte la réglementation relative à l’aménagement communal et au développement urbain. Ceux-ci ont pour objectifs d'assurer à la population de la commune des conditions de vie optimales par une mise en valeur harmonieuse et un développement durable de toutes les parties du territoire communal. A cet effet, ils ont principalement pour mission de concevoir, de développer, de coordonner et de mettre en oeuvre, au niveau communal, les moyens nécessaires pour garantir: l’utilisation rationnelle du sol et de l’espace tant urbain que rural en garantissant la complémentarité entre les objectifs économiques, écologiques et sociaux d’un développement durable, (b) le développement harmonieux des structures urbaines et rurales, y compris les réseaux de communication et d’approvisionnement compte tenu des spécificités respectives de ces structures, et en exécution des objectifs de l’aménagement général du territoire, (c) le développement, dans le cadre des structures urbaines et rurales, d’une mixité et d’une densification permettant d’améliorer à la fois la qualité de vie de la population et la qualité urbanistique des localités, (d) le respect du patrimoine culturel et naturel national et local lors de la poursuite des objectifs définis ci-dessus, (e) la sécurité, la salubrité et l’hygiène publiques. Le texte comprend 110 articles répartis en 10 titres comme suit: Définitions et objectifs (1); Les organes compétents (2); Le plan d'aménagement général (3); Le plan d'aménagement particulier (4); Le règlement sur les bâtisses, les voies publiques et les sites (5); Mesures d'exécution des plans d'aménagement (6); Dispositions pénales et mesures administratives (7); Dispositions transitoires (8); Dispositions modificatives (9); Dispositions abrogatoires (10).
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Protocole de coopération entre la Région flamande, la Région wallonne et la Région de Bruxelles-Capitale relatif au prélèvement dans le secteur du lait et des produits laitiers.
Policy_Content: Le présent Protocole de coopération entre la Région flamande, la Région wallonne et la Région de Bruxelles-Capitale est relatif au prélèvement dans le secteur du lait et des produits laitiers. L’article 1er établit que la réserve nationale pour livraisons et la réserve nationale pour ventes directes sont la différence entre les quantités de référence nationales respectives et les sommes respectives des quantités de référence individuelles allouées aux producteurs par les autorités compétentes. Ces réserves sont calculées annuellement, au niveau national, tant pour les livraisons que pour les ventes directes. L'origine régionale des quantités de références y ajoutées est identifiée sur base de l'appartenance à la zone de gestion définie à l'article 2. En outre, les organismes payeurs se communiquent annuellement les données relatives aux producteurs qui ont changé de zone de production et en assurent le suivi annuel. Pour ces producteurs, la Région gestionnaire des quantités de référence reste la Région où leurs quantités de référence étaient situées au 31 mars 2002. Le texte comprend 13 articles.

Policy: Décret exécutif n° 04-194 portant création de l’agence nationale des sciences de la terre.
Policy_Content: Il est créé sous la dénomination «Agence nationale des sciences de la terre» par abréviation «ANST», un établissement public à caractère administratif, doté de la personnalité morale et de l’autonomie financière, chargé de coordonner le développement des sciences de la terre pour le bien-être, la prospérité et la sécurité du pays et de son développement durable. Au titre de ses missions, l’agence est chargée notamment: — en concertation avec les institutions de recherche, les administrations concernées et les autres intervenants, de développer, grâce aux nouvelles technologies, l’acquisition, le traitement et la valorisation de l’information scientifique concernant la géologie, la géophysique et la géographie physique; — de proposer à la réflexion et de réaliser ou de faire réaliser des outils d’aide à la décision et notamment des cartes thématiques, des cartes des risques de toute nature, des cartes de conservation de la nature ainsi que des cartes d’occupation spatiale à des échelles appropriées; — de déterminer des priorités et/ou des axes ’évolution dans le domaine des sciences de la terre, en concertation avec les organismes qualifiés; — d’animer et de stimuler des activités intersectorielles dans le domaine des sciences de la terre; — de participer à la formation de professionnels dans le domaine des sciences de la terre.

Policy: Law No. 56 “On state regulation of agricultural land fertility”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the legal basis for state regulation of the ensuring fertility of agricultural land. Fertility of agricultural land shall be intended the ability of soil to meet the needs of agricultural plants (crops) in nutrients, air, water, heat, biological and physical and chemical environment and to ensure the productivity of agricultural plants (crops). State regulation of fertility of agricultural land shall be intended establishment of standards, norms, rates, rules, provisions in the field of ensuring fertility of agricultural land. Ecological and biological measures shall be intended a set of scientifically substantiated measures for the use of biological factors and means (crop rotation, organic fertilizers, compost, stimulants (pathogens), fossils (minerals), green manure), with a view of increasing fertility of agricultural land. Agroecological arrangements shall be intended creation by artificial means and preservation of the ecological balance of pastures, orchards and protection of protection forest belts for the purpose of sustainable production of agricultural commodities. The competence of the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan in the field of fertility of agricultural land includes: (a) implementation of state policy in the field of ensuring fertility of agricultural land; (b) approval of state programs for ensuring fertility of agricultural land; (c) approval of standards, norms, rules and regulations for agrotechnical, agrochemical, ecological and biological, meliorative, phytosanitary and anti-erosion measures; (d) coordination of the activities of the relevant national bodies and local executive bodies of state power in the field of ensuring fertility of agricultural land; (e) determination of the procedure for the implementation of state control over ensuring fertility of agricultural land; (f) nomination of the authorized state body of the Republic of Tajikistan in the field of fertility of agricultural land and approval of its statute; and (g) implementation of other competences stipulated by the legislation of the Republic of Tajikistan in the field of fertility of agricultural land. Land users shall have the right: (a) to conduct agrotechnical, agrochemical, ecological and biological, land reclamation, phytosanitary and anti-erosion measures aimed at the reproduction of soil fertility of agricultural land; and (b) to receive in accordance with the procedure established by the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan information on the state of fertility of soil on their land plots and the dynamics of changes of its condition. Land users shall have the duty: (a) to use methods for the production of agricultural commodities that contribute to the restoration of agricultural land fertility and the protection of the environment; (b) to observe the standards, norms, rates, rules and regulations for agrotechnical, agrochemical, ecological and biological, ameliorative, phytosanitary, anti-erosion measures; (c) to submit information on the use of agrochemicals, biological factors and means and pesticides to the relevant executive authorities in accordance with the procedure established by the normative legal acts of the Republic of Tajikistan; (d) to promote the implementation of agrochemical, ecological and biological, phytosanitary and ecological and toxicological soil surveys of agricultural land; (e) to inform the relevant executive authorities of the cases of degradation of agricultural land and soil contamination on land plots in their use; and (f) to perform other duties stipulated by normative legal acts of the Republic of Tajikistan. This Law consists of 6 Chapters divided into 25 Articles. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 establishes the competence of state executive bodies in the field of ensuring fertility of agricultural land. Chapter 3 establishes rights and duties of land users in the field of ensuring fertility of agricultural land. Chapter 4 regards state regulation in the field of ensuring fertility of agricultural land. Chapter 5 regards state support of activities in the field of ensuring fertility of agricultural land. Chapter 6 lays down final provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force after its official publication.

Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement flamand met en exécution l’article 11, paragraphe 9, qui lit comme suit: «Dans les limites de crédits prévus au budget de la Communauté flamande, une aide financière en vue de travaux d'entretien dont la nécessité a été prouvée, peut être accordée au propriétaire, au détenteur des droits réels ou au locataire qui est maître d'ouvrage et qui porte les frais aux conditions et dans les proportions fixées par le Gouvernement flamand.» La partie initiale de l’arrêté susmentionné contient la définition de certains termes comme, par exemple, «ministre», «décret», «preneur de prime», «auteur de projet», «plan de revalorisation», «travaux d'entretien», «éléments et caractéristiques du patrimoine», «octroi d'une prime d'entretien», «administrations régionales», «administrations locales», «travaux supplémentaires et complémentaires». L’article 2 établit que dans les limites de crédits affectés à cet effet et inscrits au budget de la Communauté flamande, le Ministre peut accorder une prime d'entretien pour des travaux d'entretien qui améliorent la conservation durable de monuments, sites urbains et ruraux protégés, pour des monuments protégés y compris les biens culturels qui en font partie intégrante, notamment l'équipement et les éléments décoratifs y appartenant, pour autant que ces travaux maintiennent ou renforcent les valeurs patrimoniales. Le texte comprend 21 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Primes d'entretien (II); Revalorisation de sites urbains et ruraux protégés (III); Dispositions finales (IV).

Policy: European Communities (Greenhouse Gas Emissions Trading) Regulations 2004 (S.I. No. 437 of 2004).
Policy_Content: These Regulations establish and specify the procedures in Ireland for participation by specified installations in the European Community greenhouse gas emissions trading scheme, in accordance with the provisions of Directive 2003/87/EC of the European Parliament. The Regulations also provide for recognition of greenhouse gas allowances issued by competent authorities in other Member States and for a bar on the transfer of allowances by installations that do not comply with the reporting and verification requirements and the payment of penalties by operators who fail to surrender for cancellation allowances equal to emissions during the preceding year. The Regulations allow for the inclusion of additional activities and gases in the greenhouse gas emissions trading scheme from  2008 and specify that this may only be done with the approval of the Minister and the European Commission. The Regulations amend the provisions in the Environmental Protection Agency Act 1992 with respect to integrated pollution prevention and control licensing and to obligatory and optional provisions for the Agency to coordinate that code with the procedures for emissions trading. Unused allowances are to be cancelled within four months of the end of each trading period. Additional and non-transferable allowances in the event of force majeure are allowed with the approval of the European Commission. The Environmental Protection Agency is required by the Regulations to make annual reports to the European Commission on greenhouse gas emissions trading.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Pollution control

Policy: Loi nº 04-05 modifiant et complétant la loi nº 90-29 relative à l'aménagement et l'urbanisme.
Policy_Content: Cette loi a pour objet de modifier et de compléter les dispositions de la loi nº 90-29 du 1er décembre 1990 relative à l’aménagement et l’urbanisme, et notamment, entre autres, les dispositions de l'article 4 qui fixe les conditions pour que les parcelles soient constructibles; de l'article 7 en base auxquelles toute construction à usage d'habitation doit justifier d'un point d'alimentation en eau potable. Elle doit, en outre, être équipée d'un système d'assainissement évitant le rejet direct des effluents en surface; de l'article 11 relatif aux instruments d'aménagement et d'urbanisme qui fixent les orientations fondamentales d'aménagement des territoires intéressés et déterminent les prévisions et les règles d'urbanisme. Les dispositions de l'article 73 prévoient que le président de l'Assemblée populaire communale ainsi que les agents dûment habilités doivent visiter les constructions en cours, procéder aux vérifications qu'ils jugent utiles et se faire communiquer, à tout moment, les documents techniques se rapportant à la construction. Aux termes de l'article 76, il est interdit d'entreprendre des travaux de construction sans permis de construire ou de les réaliser au mépris des plans graphiques ayant servi à l'obtention du permis de construire

Policy: Uranium Enrichment Technology (Prohibition on Disclosure) Regulations 2004 (S.I. No. 1818 of 2004).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prohibit the disclosure of certain equipment, software and information relating to uranium enrichment technology. Paragraph (1) of regulation 2 contains the prohibition: it covers both intentional and reckless disclosures; and applies not only to disclosures within the United Kingdom but also to disclosures by "United Kingdom persons" abroad. Paragraph (2) defines "reckless". Paragraphs (3) and (4) set out the software, equipment and information to which the prohibition applies. Regulation 3 contains exemptions. Regulations 4 and 5 provide for the Secretary of State to authorise disclosures and for the withdrawal or variation of authorisations. Regulation 6 makes provision for the sending or giving of written documents for the purposes of regulations 4 and 5.

Policy: Commonhold Regulations 2004 (S.I. No. 1829 of 2004).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under Part 1 of the Commonhold and Leasehold Reform Act 2002, make provision in England and Wales for land to be registered as a freehold estate in commonhold land. Part I of these Regulations contains general provisions. Part II contains provisions about the registration of a freehold estate in land as a freehold estate in commonhold land. Part III contains provisions which the commonhold community statement must contain when defining the extent of a commonhold unit; requires notice to be given to the Registrar when an amendment is made to a commonhold community statement redefining the extent of a commonhold unit over which there is a registered charge and requires the Registrar to alter the register to reflect the application of sections 24(4) or (5); and prescribes the conditions which must be met before a term of years absolute in the whole or part of a residential commonhold unit may be granted. Part IV specifies the requirements for the name of a commonhold association, makes provision for the form and content of the commonhold community statement and the memorandum and articles of association of a commonhold association and specifies the Forms to be used in accordance with the commonhold community statement of a commonhold. Part V contains provisions dealing with the operation of a commonhold, and in particular rights or duties arising from the commonhold community statement. Part VI makes provision for termination of a commonhold.

Policy: Arrêté ministériel modifiant l'arrêté ministériel du 24 novembre 2000 concernant les aides aux investissements et à l'installation dans l'agriculture.
Policy_Content: L’article 13 de l'arrêté ministériel du 24 novembre 2000 concernant les aides aux investissements et à l'installation dans l'agriculture est remplacé par la disposition suivante: «Art. 13. L'aide au démarrage, visée à l'article 23 du même arrêté du Gouvernement flamand, ne peut pas dépasser les frais globaux de gestion effectivement justifiés pour la première année d'activité. Sont acceptées comme frais de gestion, les dépenses suivantes : la location d'immeubles appropriés, l'achat d'équipements de bureau, les frais de personnel administratif, les frais généraux et les indemnités couvrant les actes juridiques et administratifs. La prime est payée au prorata de 50 % à la fin de la première année d'activité et le restant en deux fois à la fin des deux années suivantes. Lors de la transformation d'une association de fait en une personne morale, l'association ne peut avoir obtenu aucune aide au démarrage et seuls des frais spécifiques liés à la transformation sont éligibles à l'aide. Le groupement ne peut pas être dissout avant la sixième année d'activité.» Le texte comprend 2 articles.

Policy: Decree No. D1-385 of the Minister of Environment validating the Statute of Environmental Protection Agency.
Policy_Content: Environmental Protection Agency shall be budgetary institution, a public entity constituted by the Ministry of Environment. The Agency shall perform the following tasks: (a) to maintain environmental quality and ensure sustainable use of natural resources; (b) to assess environmental data and submit information to state institutions with a view of formulating environmental policy; and (c) to raise public awareness in the field of environmental protection. The Agency shall perform the following functions: (a) drafting of laws, rules and regulations in the sphere of environmental protection; (b) establishes water protection targets for surface waterbodies and keeps register of surface waterbodies, including classification of ponds, lakes and other waterbodies; (c) organizes state environmental monitoring; (d) performs analysis of hazardous pollutants and identifies pollution sources; (e) organizes environmental research and laboratory testing of pollutants; (f) performs environmental impact assessment; and (g) performs, within its sphere of competence, environmental audit.

Policy: Mountain law.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes basic rules relative to the conservation and development of mountain areas in Romania. The mountain area of Romania is delimited in accordance with principles laid down in Government Decision No. 948 of 2002 and in accordance with criteria set out in article 1 of this Law. One of the aims of the Law is maintaining and ecological balance in development of mountain areas and article 2 prescribes that the objectives of sustainable mountain development are to be achieved by the National Agency for Mountain Areas, being a division of the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Rural Development, in a collaboration with specialized institutions, the Ministry and local authorities. Objectives principles of the mountain policy are set out in article 3. Tasks of the National Agency for mountain development are set out in article 4. Article 5 concerns organization of representation of interests of agricultural producers in mountain areas. Articles 6 and 7 make provision for an “agri-mountain” education programme at various levels of the regular school programme and other organized education. Land can be given at no costs to institutions that can prove that they will contribute to development of mountain areas. Articles 8 to 19 provide for various kinds of incentives for (agricultural) activities to be carried out in mountain areas. Article 12 concerns land consolidation, article 13 concerns soil conservation and articles 14 and 15 the use of grasslands. Grasslands in protected areas may be given in use to farmers on the basis of five-year contracts.

Policy: Order No. 373 validating the Regulation on the storage, transport and application of pesticides.
Policy_Content: This Order determines modalities for the storage, transport and application of chemical pesticides and herbicides with a view to preventing negative effects on human health and the environment resulting from their use. It shall be mandatory for natural and legal persons. Pesticides shall be stored at special storage facilities in compliance with ecological, sanitary and epidemiological requirements. The aforesaid storage facilities shall contain a general section for storing pesticides, a section for storing inflammable and highly explosive substances, and a section for storing extremely hazardous substances (Category 1). The amount of stored pesticides must not exceed projected storage capacity. Transportation of foodstuffs, fodder or potable water together with pesticides, or in a conveyance previously used to transport pesticides, shall be prohibited. Application of pesticides shall be carried out exclusively where a registration certificate has been obtained.

Policy: Allied Health Professions Act, 2004 (No. 7 of 2004).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Allied Health Professions Council of Namibia, defines its functions and powers and provides with respect to its administration. It also provides with respect to registration of allied or complementary health practitioners and supervision by the Council of their qualifications, training, activities, etc. The category of allied or complementary health practitioner includes, among other things, dieticians, environmental health practitioners, food inspectors, and nutritionists. No person is entitled to practise within Namibia the profession of allied or complementary health practitioner unless registered with the Council. The Act also establishes professional committees such as the Professional Committee for Environmental Health and Related Professions and the Professional Committee for Dietetics, for the professions of the dieticians and the nutritionists.

Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Wreck and Salvage Act 5 of 2004.
Policy_Content: This Act applies whenever judicial or arbitration proceedings relating to salvage of ships and aircraft are brought in Namibia. The Act regulates jurisdictional matters. It also sets up a series of obligations: to assist ships/aircrafts in distress as well as to render assistance to persons in danger at sea. It establishes the duty of the masters of ships in collision and assigns to the the Minister the faculty to appoint suitably qualified persons to be salvage officers at ports or other places in Namibia in respect of any defined area. The Act regulates, more generally, all the aspects inherent to the salvage operations ( powers of salvage officers, interfering with wrecked ship or aircraft, salvage contracts, duties of salvors and of owners and masters of ships, conditions for reward etc.)

Policy: National Water Policy.
Policy_Content: The National Water (NWP) provides a framework for addressing challenges in water resources management and conservation in Nigeria. Challenges include: inadequate catchment management and widespread pollution, including the indiscriminate disposal of hazardous substances; limited groundwater availability in the areas of the country underlain by crystalline rocks and heavy and uncontrolled groundwater exploitation in the more productive sedimentary areas; poor watershed management, deteriorating water quality, drought and desertification; water-related diseases. The NWP seeks to achieve, among other things: clear and coherent regulation; clear definitions of the functions and relationship of sector institutions; better funding; reliable and adequate data for planning and projections; decentralization in order to boost efficiency, performance and sustainability; autonomy of water supply agencies; public awareness about water conservation and management; provision of stable and adequate power supply; accountability; technical and financial capacity building to efficiently manage water delivery systems; human resource development.

Policy: Law  No. 588-II on the electric power industry.
Policy_Content: The present Law regulates social relations emerging in the process of generation, transmission and usage of electric and heat energy. Governmental regulation in Electric Power Industry is aimed at: (i) maximum meeting the demand of electric energy customers and protection of the rights of the electric and heat energy market members (ii) provision of reliable and uninterruptible operation of the electric power complex; (iii) unified control of the electric energy complex. The Law consists of six Chapters divided into 25 articles dealing with the following matters: general provisions (Chapt. 1); governmental regulation in the electric power industry (Chapt. 2); system operator (Chapt. 3); power supply (Chapt. 4); operation of the electric energy facilities under emergencies (Chapt. 5) and final and transitional provisions (Chapt. 6).  Governmental regulation objectives in the electric power industry are: (a) efficient functioning and development of the electric power complex on the basis of unity of management and competition development; (b) rational and economic use of electric and heat energy; (c) usage and development of renewable and non-conventional power sources; (d) protection of the environment; (e) energy supply to remote areas of the country; (f) establishment of standards for electric energy quality. Governmental regulation in the area of electric energy includes: (a) licensing; (b) supervision over reliability, safety and cost-effectiveness of electricity generation, transmission, system dispatching, and consumption; (c) technical and technological requirements set for generation, transmission, system dispatching and consumption of electric and heat energy.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Decreto Nº 541 - Ley de Desarrollo Social para el Estado de Zacatecas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley busca garantizar el pleno ejercicio de los derechos sociales consagrados a nivel constitucional, asegurando el acceso de toda la población al desarrollo social. Para ello establece un Sistema Estatal de Desarrollo Social en el que participen el gobierno del Estado y de los municipios y fija las bases para la prestación de los bienes y servicios contenidos en los programas sociales. Entre los principios rectores de la política de desarrollo social se incluye el principio de sostenibilidad, entendido como la preservación del equilibrio ecológico, protección del ambiente y aprovechamiento de recursos naturales, para mejorar la calidad de vida y la productividad de las personas, sin comprometer la satisfacción de las necesidades de las generaciones futuras (art. 3). En cuanto a los derechos sociales contemplados, cabe destacar el derecho a la alimentación, a la salud y al disfrute de un medio ambiente sano (art. 6). En lo que refiere a la Política Estatal de Desarrollo Social, ésta contempla entre otros aspectos los siguientes: a) superación de la pobreza a través de la educación, la salud, la alimentación, la generación de empleo e ingreso, autoempleo y capacitación; b) seguridad social y programas asistenciales.

Policy: Law No. 14.453 providing for the State Policy to Support the Indigenous Communities of Paraná.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 11 articles, provides for the State Policy to Support the Indigenous Communities of Paraná. This State Policy aims to promote and encourage the self-preservation of indigenous communities, assuring them the right to special assistance in health, education and productive activities, in compliance with the recognition of their culture and social organization. The Policy objectives are: provide special assistance to peoples, indigenous communities, aiming at the equity of services rendered; guarantee these peoples the means for their self-support, respecting their cultural differences; ensure indigenous peoples the freedom to choose their livelihoods and subsistence; promote respect for the social organization, customs, languages ​​and traditions of indigenous peoples and communities, all their goods, ways of living, cultural and artistic values ​​and other forms of expression; implement, with indigenous peoples participation, actions, programmes and projects that benefit them; guarantee indigenous the permanent possession and the exclusive usufruct of their traditional lands; protect assets of artistic, historical and cultural value, archaeological sites and other forms of reference to the identity, action and history of indigenous peoples and communities.

Policy: Regional Law No. 11-2182 regarding the modalities of transfer of land from one category into another.
Policy_Content: The present Regional Law determines the modalities of transfer of land from one category into another. The Regional Law is valid only until the entry into force of the Federal Law regulating this issue. The present Regional Law does not apply to the relations connected with transfer of forest land. The Regional Law consists of 14 articles. Article 1 establishes the sphere of application of the present regional law. Article 2 introduces the main concepts. Article 3 regards authorized institutions. Article 4 establishes the grounds for transfer of land from one category into another. Article 5 deals with applications for transfer. Article 6 lists the documentation to be attached to the applications for transfer. Article 7 regards the procedure of the examination of the applications for transfer. Article 8 regards rejection of transfer. Article 9 regards modification of the documentation in relation to transfer of land. Article 10 regards transfer of agricultural land into another categories of land. Article 8 regards the modalities of transfer of land from one category into another in case of expropriation (purchase) of land for state or municipal needs. Article 9 regards transfer of agricultural land into another categories of land. Article 11 regards transfer of industrial, energy, communication, broadcasting television, information, space, defence, safety and other types of land of special destination into other categories of land. Article 12 regards transfer of reserve land. Article 13 regards entry into force of the present Regional Law. Article 14 establishes the period of validity of the present Regional Law.

Policy: Resolution CONAMA No. 350 providing for the environmental specific licensing for activities of seismic data acquisition in maritime and transitional zones.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 12 articles, provides for the environmental specific licensing for activities of seismic data acquisition in maritime and transitional zones. These activities will be subject to environmental licensing as they are potentially causing environmental impacts, which will comply with specific rules due to their temporary nature, mobility and the absence of fixed installations. The environmental licensing of seismic data should comply with the following steps: 1. referral of the FCA by the entrepreneur; 2. framework of activities by IBAMA, considering the following classes: a) Class 1 Surveys in depth of less than 50 m or in areas of environmental sensitivity, subject to the elaboration of Plan for Environmental Control of Seismic activity (PCAS) and Environmental Studies of Seismic/Seismic Environmental Impact Report (EAS/RIAS); b) Class 2 Deep surveys between 50 and 200 m, subject to the elaboration of PCAS and EAS/RIAS; c) Class 3 Surveys in excess of 200 m, subject to the preparation of PCAS; 3. issuance of the Terms of Reference by IBAMA, within 15 working days, counted from the date of protocol of the request; 4. delivery of documentation by the entrepreneur, together with the application of LPS; 5. assistance by the developer of clarifications and additional information, if requested, within a maximum period of four months, counted from the receipt of the respective notification, which may be extended, if justified, agreed with IBAMA and required up to 30 days before its expiration; 6. manifestation of IBAMA by the deferral or rejection of the LPS.

In case of accomplishment of administrative offences in the sphere of environmental protection by citizens and officials the authorized bodies of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and state inspectors of environmental protection shall draw reports in conformity with the forms contained in the Annexes 1 and 2. In case of exposure of environmental offences accomplished by the officials of the enterprises, institutions and the organizations irrespectively of the form of property or departmental subordination thereof the report of administrative offence shall be drawn against the official responsible for environmental protection at the aforesaid enterprise, institution or organization. If such a person has not been designated the report should be drawn against the superior. If the offences are related to damages caused to environment by soil pollution and water pollution these shall be referred to in the report.

Policy: Law amending some provisions of Forest Law No. 6831.
Policy_Content: This Law revokes and amends some provisions of the Forestry Law No. 6831 as follows: All kinds of products and goods recovered from blazed forests will be managed by the General Directorate of Forestry. The Ministry of Environment and Forestry is authorized to grant license to individuals and companies to erect and install transportation, defense, energy, communication, water, waste water, natural gas, and waste disposal facilities, dams and ponds, health, training and sports facilities on areas classified as state forests. The license could not exceed forty nine years. All facilities and buildings shall be transferred to the General Directorate of Forestry after license expiration, and then used by them or by the Ministry of Environment and Forestry or could be rented to third parties. License could be extended up to ninety nine years with an annual fee that would be determined through current values of the buildings and installations. The Law also defines compensations to be paid to those who participates forest fire fighting efforts. Buildings and facilities on areas subject to National Parks Law No. 2873 could be leased for a period of twenty nine years.

Policy: Regional Law No. 734-KZ “On protection of atmospheric air”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of atmospheric air protection. Basic principles of atmospheric air protection shall be: (a) priority of protection of human life and health; (b) ensuring favourable  ecological conditions; (c) compulsory state regulation of emissions to the atmospheric air; (d) transparency, openness and access to reliable information of the state of atmospheric air and air pollution; (e) enforcement of air protection legislation and liability; and (f) prevention of irreversible consequences of atmospheric air pollution. Atmospheric air quality rate setting and maximum allowable emission limits shall be set forth with a view of atmospheric air protection. Manufacturing, trade and use of motor vehicles and other mobile pollution sources, which emissions exceed established emission levels, shall be prohibited. Local self-government shall organize regular atmospheric air monitoring.

Policy: Demoted Tenancies (Review of Decisions)(England) Regulations 2004 (S.I. No. 1679 of 2004).
Policy_Content: If a landlord wishes to end a demoted tenancy it must serve the tenant with a notice stating that the landlord has decided to apply to the court for an order for possession, setting out the reasons for that decision and informing the tenant of his right to request a review of the decision. These Regulations make provision about the procedure to be followed in such a review. Regulation 2 provides that a review must be undertaken by a person who was not involved in the original decision. If the original decision was made by an officer then any review of that decision by another officer may only be carried out by an officer occupying a more senior position within the landlord's organization than the officer who made the original decision. Regulation 3 requires the landlord to give the tenant notice of the date of the review. Regulation 4 enables the tenant to obtain an oral hearing in certain circumstances and explains how that right may be exercised. Regulations 5 to 9 set out the details of the review procedure.
Subject: Land & soil

The requirement for environmental assessment applies, in particular, to any plan or programme prepared for agriculture, forestry, fisheries, energy, industry, transport, waste management, water management, telecommunications, tourism, town and country planning or land use, which sets the framework for future development consent of projects listed in Annex I or II to Council Directive 85/337/EEC on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private projects on the environment, as amended by Council Directive 97/11/EC; and to any plan or programme which, in view of the likely effect on sites, has been determined to require an assessment pursuant to Article 6 or 7 of Council Directive 92/43/EEC on the conservation of natural habitats and of wild flora and fauna and applies to other specified plans and programmes. Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée l’Agence nationale pour la Relance des Activités économiques et sociales en Casamance (ANRAC) dont la mission est de faciliter la restauration rapide d’un environnement économique et social favorable dans les régions de Ziguinchor et de Kolda, semblable à celui du reste du Sénégal, et de poser les bases d’un développement durable à long terme dans lesdites régions, tout en respectant leurs spécificités.

Policy: Plant Health (Export Certification) (Forestry) (Great Britain) Order 2004 (S.I. No. 1684 of 2004).
Policy_Content: This Order makes provision for the issue of phytosanitary certificates and reforwarding phytosanitary certificates for export of relevant material (any tree, wood, isolated bark, soil or growing medium, non-manufactured wood or used forestry machinery) to third countries to satisfy the requirements of those countries' phytosanitary regulations. Article 3 makes provision for the making of applications for and the issue of phytosanitary certificates and reforwarding phytosanitary certificates. Article 4 and Schedule 3 prescribe the fees payable by applicants for such certificates. Article 5 provides that it shall be an offence knowingly or recklessly to make a false statement or to intentionally fail to disclose material information for the purpose of obtaining the issue of a certificate.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Act No. LXVII of 2004 regarding public interest and implementation of the programme aimed to increase the protection against flood in the Tisza River basin, and for land planning and rural development of the surrounding area (re-development of the Vásárhelyi Plan).
Policy_Content: Ensuring the protection against flood, and thus planning, regulating, organizing, governing, controlling of flood preventive activities, through the construction, development, maintenance and operation of protective waterworks (mainly reservoirs and canals) of non-local competence, shall be the duty of the State. This Act applies to the tasks and activities related to the re-development, planning, preparation and realization of the Vásárhelyi Plan (improvement of the capacity of water flow in the principal bed, creation and restoration of floodplain zones, etc.) . For this purposes, the State has the right of pre-emption or expropriation over land plots along the planned waterworks. The Act determines the rules of administrative and legal proceedings, defines the competence of authorities involved, in particular regarding the authorization of the environmental protection and water management authorities. This Act foresees the employment of jobless public workers for the restoration and maintenance of the principal river bed.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The consolidated version of the text entered into force on 30 March 2011.

Policy: Loi nº 2004-049 portant Code pétrolier.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de définir le régime juridique et fiscal des activités de prospection, de recherche, d'exploitation, de  raffinage, de transport et de commercialisation des hydrocarbures sur le territoire de la République du Niger. Les substances et ressources en hydrocarbures situées dans le sol et le sous-sol du territoire national sont propriété de I'Etat et ne peuvent être, sous réserve de la présente loi, susceptibles d'aucune forme d'appropriation privée. Le permis d'exploitation est immeuble. L'autorisation de prospection confère à son titulaire, dans un périmètre défini, le droit d'exécuter des travaux de prospection d'hydrocarbures; elle est accordée par arrêté du ministre chargé des hydrocarbures pour une durée de six mois, renouvelable une seule fois.

Policy: Decree No. 33 of 2004 of the Ministry of Interiors on the rules of central and local registration of radioactive substances.
Policy_Content: The central register shall be built up and kept by the National Agency for Nuclear Energy. This Decree determines the rules of registration and operation. Radioactive substances put on the market must bear a certificate. Entities being proprietors of radioactive substances or having activities relative to them must be authorized. Authorized entities must keep a local register of the radioactive substances in their possession. Policy: Regional Law No.38-ZRT on environmental protection.
Policy_Content: The present Regional Law regulates the relations in the sphere of inter-action between the society and the nature, originating from economic and other activities producing environmental impact. The Regional Law consists of 11 Chapters composed of 41 articles. Chapter 1 (arts. 1-5) lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 (arts. 6-7) ensures the right of citizens to favourable environment. Chapter 3 (arts. 8-9) establishes the authority of the bodies of state power in the sphere of environmental protection. Chapter 4 (arts. 10-17) sets environmental rate setting. Chapter 5 (arts. 18-22) classifies protected areas. Chapter 6 (arts. 23-27) regards economic regulation in the sphere of environmental protection. Chapter 7 (art. 28) regards ecological disasters and emergencies. Chapter 8 (arts. 29-34) regards ecological audit. Chapter 9 (arts. 35-36) regards information and scientific substantiation of the activity in the sphere of environmental protection. Chapter 10 (arts. 37-39) regards dispute settlement. Chapter 11 (arts. 40-41) lays down the final provisions. The following objects shall be protected against pollution, destruction, degradation, exhaustion, annihilation and other negative impact from economic and other activities: 1) land, soil and subsoil; 2) forests and other vegetation, biological diversity and other organisms and genetic fund thereof; 3) surface water and groundwater; 4) atmospheric air and ozone layer; 5) other environmental objects envisaged by the federal legislation, first of all ecosystems, natural landscapes and nature complexes that were spared anthropogenic impact. The Regional Law declares total and complex ecological education and instruction (art. 7). Ecological certification shall be carried out in conformity with the federal legislation (art. 13). Environmental impact assessment (art. 15) and ecological audit (art. 16) shall be carried out in conformity with the modalities set by the federal legislation. Negative environmental impact shall be charged (art. 25). The Regional Law introduces the concept of ecological insurance against ecological risks (art. 27).
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Council of Ministers Regulation to provide for the implementation of Cooperative Societies Proclamation No. 147/1998 (No. 106/2004).

Policy: Law No.1864-IV on ecological network.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the legislation on ecological network is the regulation of social relations in the sphere of formation, conservation, rational and inexhaustible management of ecological network with the aim of ensuring stable, ecologically balanced development of the Ukraine, environmental protection, meeting the modern, prospective economic, social, ecological and other public interests (art. 2). Ecological network is the common territorial system set up with the purpose of the formation and renewal of environment, rising up the natural resources potential of the Ukraine, conservation of landscape and biological diversity, natural habitats of animals and plants, genetic resources, migration routes of wildlife species by unification of protected areas. Natural reserves, water bodies, forest stock, agricultural areas destined for extensive growing of plants (grazing, haymaking) pertain to the ecological network (art. 3). The principles of the formation, conservation and management of ecological network are: 1) ensuring the integrity of ecosystem functions of single components thereof; 2) conservation of ecological balance of the management of natural resources on the territory of ecological network; 3) expansion of the territories of ecological network; 4) state support of the subjects of economic activity in case of organization on their territory of protected areas; 5) ensuring unification of the national ecological network with the ecological networks of the neighbouring states and  Pan-European ecological network (art. 4). Insertion of the territories and objects into the register of protected areas and objects of ecological network shall be carried out with the consideration thereof from the point of view of ecology, botany, zoology and landscape. In the first category shall be included areas of fundamental importance as regards landscape and biological diversity (art. 17). The state monitoring of ecological network envisages preventive arrangements aimed at assessment of the integrity of ecological network, timely exposure of negative changes and prognostication of the possible impact and consequences thereof, and the elaboration of the recommendations concerning conservation and management of ecological network (art. 20).  Territories and objects pertaining to the ecological network shall be subject to compulsory registration (art. 21). The Law consists of 4 Sections composed of 25 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Law No. 212 “On the state of emergency, siege and martial law.”
Policy_Content: State of emergency shall be intended a set of measures of political, economic, social nature and maintenance of public order temporarily introduced in certain areas or on the whole territory of the country in case of inevitability of occurrence or occurrence of emergency situations of natural, anthropogenic or socio-biological nature, which makes it necessary to prevent, reduce and eliminate their consequences.  This law establishes: (a) the grounds, procedure and conditions for declaring the emergency, siege or martial law, as well as the competence of bodies declaring the state of emergency, siege or martial law; (b) measures applied during a state of emergency, siege or martial law and also the rights, duties and responsibilities of legal persons and natural persons during this period. During the period of state of emergency, siege or martial law, some powers of central and local public administration authorities are vested in the competent bodies provided for by this Law, in accordance with the procedure, established by the Government. In the event of the state of emergency, siege or martial law, the competent bodies shall be vested with the powers of central and local public administration. During the introduction of the state of emergency, siege or martial law, central and local public administration bodies shall carry out only those powers that have not been delegated to the competent authorities and are obliged to support them. The state of emergency shall be declared on the proposal of the President of the Republic of Moldova or by the Government. State of emergency may be declared for a period not exceeding 60 days. Depending on the evolution of the situation, the President of the Republic of Moldova or the Government may request Parliament to extend or reduce the period of validity of the state of emergency, as well as to expand or reduce its area of application. For the duration of the state of emergency, depending on the specific circumstances, the following measures may be taken: (a) rationing of food consumption; and (b) introduction of quarantine and application of other mandatory sanitary and other anti-epidemic arrangements. This Law contains VIII Chapters divided into 67 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II establishes the procedure for the proclamation and cancellation of emergency, siege and martial law. Chapter III regards emergency situation. Chapter IV regards introduction of siege. Chapter V regards introduction of martial law. Chapter VI regards the administration of justice during emergency, siege of martial law. It establishes the particulars of criminal procedures and administrative offences. Chapter VII establishes liability during emergency, siege of martial law.  Chapter VIII lays down final and transitional provisions.
Subject: Food & nutrition, General
Keyword: Disasters,Local government,Offences/penalties,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Human rights,Food security,Nutrition

Policy: Law No. 1808-IV on state expertise of land use documentation.
Policy_Content: The present Law establishes legal, organizational and financial basis for carrying out state expertise of land use documentation and the modalities of tits carrying out. State expertise of land use documentation is activity aimed at valuation, control and analysis of the objects of expertise for the purpose of the compliance thereof with the legislative requirements, standards, norms and instructions, and also elaboration of substantiated conclusions for decision-making as regards the objects of the expertise. The main targets of state expertise are: 1) organization of complex, scientifically substantiated valuation of the objects of expertise; 2) compliance of the objects of expertise with the legislative requirements, standards, norms and instructions; 3) elaboration of the objective and substantiated requirements of the state expertise. The objects of the state expertise are land use documentation and land valuation documentation that is established by the legislation, and also materials and documentation of state land cadastre. The following are subject to obligatory state examination: (a) land use planning schemes and feasibility studies for the use and protection of lands of administrative-territorial units; (b) land survey projects to establish (change) the boundaries of administrative-territorial units; (c) land survey projects for the organization and establishment of boundaries of nature reserves and other environmental purposes, health, recreational, historical and cultural, forestry, water fund land and water protection zones, restrictions on land use and their regime-forming objects; (d) land survey projects for the allocation of land plots of particularly valuable lands, forest land, as well as land of water fund, nature protection, health, recreational and historical and cultural purposes; (e) land survey projects for landscaping of settlements; (f) land survey projects for land privatization of state and communal agricultural enterprises, institutions and organizations; (g) technical documentation on land survey for land inventory in case of formation of land plots at the expense of particularly valuable land, forest land, as well as land of water fund, nature protection, health, recreational and historical and cultural heritage; and (h) technical documentation on soil quality assessment, normative monetary valuation of land plots. The Law consists of 9 Sections that contain 42 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-7) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 8-15) specifies the forms and the types of state expertise. Section 3 (arts. 16-22) regards regulation in the sphere of state expertise. Section 4 (arts. 23-26) determines the status of expert of state expertise. Section 5(arts. 27-30) determines the rights and the duties of the customers of state expertise and projectors of the objects of state expertise. Section 6 (arts.31-39) establishes the modalities of carrying out state expertise. Section 7 (art. 40) establishes liability for the infringement of the legislation in the sphere of state expertise. Section 8 (arts. 41 and 42) regards international agreements in the sphere of state expertise. Section 9 lays down final provisions.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Article 3 regards sphere of application of the present Law. Article 4 establishes the main tasks and methods of consultation activity. Article 5 regards financing of consultation activity. Article 6 regards socially oriented consultation services. Article 7 regards regulation of consultation activity. Article 8 regards state support of consultation activity. Article 9 regards register of consultants and consultation services. Article 10 regards professional training of consultants and experts-consultants. Article 11 regards qualification certificates. Article 12 imposes restriction of the use of terms “agricultural consultation service”, “agricultural consultant” and “agricultural expert-consultant”.

The Law consists of the following six Chapters: (I) General Provisions; (II) State Structures of Agricultural Land Protection, their Tasks and Responsibilities; (III) Agricultural Land Damage Prevention; (IV) Obligation to Inform on Agricultural Land Damage and Rehabilitation of Damaged Lands; (V) Administrative Offences and Sanctions; (VI) Final Provisions.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 27.572 - Regula el procedimiento de saneamiento de tierras en el norte amazónico.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto reglar de manera excepcional, en el marco del procedimiento de saneamiento en el norte amazónico, la aplicación de la unidad mínima de dotación por familia, atendiendo las necesidades emergentes del proceso de saneamiento en el norte amazónico del país, a fin de garantizar el derecho de propiedad comunal, así como el derecho de acceso a personas individuales o colectivas a través de la concesión forestal al aprovechamiento de los recursos forestales no maderables y el uso sostenible de los recursos naturales renovables. El Decreto ratifica el derecho de las comunidades campesinas e indígenas en el Norte Amazónico del país, a la dotación de propiedades comunarias cuya superficie se calcula sobre la base de la unidad mínima de dotación por familia de quinientas (500) hectáreas, tal como está establecido en el Artículo 1 del Decreto Supremo No 25848 de 18 de julio de 2000. Son beneficiarios de la dotación sin más trámite por tierra insuficiente, todas las comunidades indígenas y campesinas que habiendo accedido a una propiedad comunaria como resultado de un proceso de saneamiento, no se satisface la superficie mínima de 500 hectáreas por familia establecida en la normativa vigente. También se regula el procedimiento de reconocimiento por parte del Estado vía concesión, a ser aplicado por la Superintendencia Forestal, al derecho de acceso y aprovechamiento de los recursos no-maderables por personas individuales o colectivas. El Decreto declara de prioridad nacional la conclusión del saneamiento en el Norte Amazónico del país, debiendo el Estado proveer los recursos para este fin.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil
Keyword: Non-timber products,Concession,Sustainable use,Indigenous peoples,Common property,Procedural matters,Land tenure,Ownership,Land reform,Dispute settlement

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 27572 - Regula el procedimiento de saneamiento de tierras en el norte amazónico.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo tiene por objeto reglar de manera excepcional la aplicación de la unidad mínima de dotación por familia, atendiendo las necesidades emergentes del proceso de saneamiento en el norte amazónico del país, a fin de garantizar el derecho de propiedad comunal, así como el derecho de acceso a personas individuales o colectivas a través de la concesión forestal al aprovechamiento de los recursos forestales no maderables y el uso sostenible de los recursos naturales renovables. Las dos finalidades del Decreto son: I. Regular el procedimiento de saneamiento aplicado en el norte amazónico con el fin de garantizar el derecho de propiedad agraria de comunidades campesinas e indígenas; y II. Reconocer el derecho de acceso al aprovechamiento vía concesión forestal en el marco de las leyes y normas conexas, a personas individuales o colectivas, que se benefician de los recursos forestales no maderables por lo menos cinco (5) años antes de la promulgación de la Ley Nº 1700 de 12 de julio de 1996.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 770 regarding governmental institutions subordinated to the Ministry of Environmental Protection and validating the Regulation on the State Inspection of Forest Protection, Conservation, Forest Management and Afforestation and the Regulation on the State Ecological Inspection.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to establish that the State Ecological Inspection, the State Service of Nature Reserves and the State Hydro-meteorological Service shall be subordinated to the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources. The State Inspection of Forest Protection, Conservation, Forest Management and Afforestation (State Forest Inspection) is the governmental institution subordinated to the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources. The main functions of the State Forest Inspection are to take part within its sphere of competence in carrying out the state policy in the sphere of forest protection, conservation, forest management and afforestation, and also state control over compliance with the requirements of forest legislation. The State Forest Inspection shall carry out the following functions: 1) organization of state control of forest management and management of nature reserves and protected areas; 2) implementation of regulations, standards and requirements of state environmental audit; 3) validation of the requirements regarding timber extraction and cutting areas; 4) elaboration of the norms and standards in the sphere of forest protection, conservation, forest management and afforestation. The State Ecological Inspection is the governmental institution subordinated to the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources. The main functions of the State Ecological Inspection are to take part within its sphere of competence in carrying out the state policy in the sphere of environmental protection, rational management of natural resources (land, surface water, atmospheric air, wildlife and vegetable kingdom, natural resources of territorial sea, continental shelf and the EEZ of the Ukraine), management of waste, pesticides and agro-chemicals, ensuring environmental and radiation safety.

Policy: Regional Law No. 75/2004-OZ “On turnover of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations concerning ownership, land tenure, and disposal of agricultural land, and also land shares in common property, establishing plenary powers of regional administration and local government in the sphere of turnover of agricultural land. It lays down terms and conditions for allotment of plots of agricultural land pertaining to state and municipal property. Agricultural land shall be used exclusively for agricultural production. Privatization of agricultural land shall start from the date of entry into force of this legislative act. Regional administration shall have preferential terms for purchase of agricultural land in case of sale thereof, except for public sale through auction or tender. Agricultural organizations and peasant farms having agricultural land plots on condition of permanent (open-ended) or hereditary tenancy shall be granted the right of purchase in ownership thereof at the price of three percent of cadastre value of the aforesaid agricultural land plots.

Policy: Law No. 70 “On cooperatives”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal and economic basis for the functioning of cooperatives and associations thereof on the national territory. It establishes that cooperative shall be voluntary association of the producers of commodities. Minimum number of the members of cooperative shall be 7. Land (shares of land) owned by the members of cooperative can be transferred to agricultural production cooperatives in accordance with land lease contract that shall be subject to revision in case of exclusion of a member from cooperative. Agricultural cooperatives can be set for the following purposes: (a) production of agricultural commodities (animal breeding and plant cultivation); (b) processing of agricultural commodities; (c) trade, storage, packaging of agricultural commodities, drainage, veterinary services, application of fertilizers and pesticides; and (d) other activities authorized by the legislation. The Act consists of 5 Sections divided into 35 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) constitution of cooperative; (3) membership in cooperative; (4) managing bodies of cooperatives; and (5) property and assets of cooperative.

Policy: National Environmental Policy.
Policy_Content: The National Environmental Policy of Malawi is a cross-sectoral policy with the following objectives: Secure for all persons, now and in the future, an environment suitable for their health and well being; Promote sustainable utilization and management of the country's natural resources and encourage, where appropriate, long term self sufficiency in food, fuel wood and other energy requirements; Facilitate the restoration, maintenance and enhancement of the ecosystems and ecological processes essential for the functioning of the biosphere and prudent use of renewable resources; Promote the ecosystems management approach so as to ensure that sectoral mandates and responsibilities are fully and effectively channelled towards sustainable environment and natural resources management; Enhance public education and awareness of various environmental issues and public participation in addressing them; Integrate sustainable environment and natural resources management into the decentralized governance systems and ensure that the institutional framework for the management of the environment and natural resources supports environmental governance in local government authorities; Promote local community, Non-Governmental Organisations (NGO) and private sector participation in environment and natural resources management; Promote the use and application of local knowledge and norms that facilitate sustainable environment and natural resources management; Promote cooperation with other Governments and relevant regional and international organizations in the management and conservation of the environment; Develop and regularly update environmental information systems to facilitate planning and decision-making at local, national and international levels; Facilitate development and regular review of policies and legislation to promote sustainable management of the environment and natural resources; Facilitate development of mechanisms for management of conflicts in the environment and natural resources sector. To improve human welfare and sustainable environment and natural resources management the policy has established guiding principles: Natural resources and the environment are the bedrock of the country’s wealth, livelihood and prosperity. Unless sustainably managed and equitably and fairly distributed, they can be sources of conflicts, resentment and consequently environmental degradation and unsustainable utilization of natural resources; Poverty is one of the root causes of environmental degradation in Malawi and is at the core of the government's development agenda for the foreseeable future. Its alleviation is critical to natural resource conservation, protection and sustainable utilization. Regarding land tenure and land use, promote sustainable use of the land resources of Malawi, primarily, but not exclusively, for agricultural purposes by strengthening and clearly defining security of tenure over land resources. The following guiding principles have been established: the provision of security of tenure for smallholder farmers against estate expansion is important for sustainable resource-based production systems (including trees); Empowering CBOs to regulate resource management on common property in their respective areas should be given high priority; Customary rights to land and resource use will be recognized and protected, or alternatives provided, including the opportunity to convert to leasehold; A comprehensive land policy should encompass not only property rights to land but also other natural resources (e.g. trees, water, fisheries, wetlands, minerals, rangelands and wildlife); Land use planning and classification is essential for sustainable environment and natural resources management.

Policy: Malawi National Strategy for Sustainable Development 2004.
Policy_Content: The Malawi National Strategy for Sustainable Development (NSSD) 2004 is a multi-sectoral policy at the national level. The objective of the National Strategy for Sustainable Development is to provide the basis for Malawi‘s sustainable development framework to implement the recommendations made at the World Summit on Sustainable Development (WSSD) held in Johannesburg, from 26th August to 4th September 2002.  Specifically, the strategy will:  provide Malawi‘s priority areas for environment management and socio-economic development for the next 10 to 15 years;  be the basis for accessing donor resources pledged at the WSSD held in Johannesburg from 26th August to 4th September, 2002;  assist to stimulate sustainable economic growth; and,  contribute to the sustainable reduction of poverty in the country.

Policy: Décret n° 2004-262/PRES/PM//MECV/ MAHRH/MS portant adoption de règles nationales en matière de sécurité en biotechnologie
Policy_Content: Le présent décret adopte les règles nationales du Burkina Faso en matière de sécurité en biotechnologie. Les règles ont été élaborées pour prévenir les éventuels effets nuisibles sur la santé humaine et l'environnement des travaux réalisés en laboratoire sur l’Acide Désoxyribonucléique (ADN) recombinant et de la dissémination délibérée dans l'environnement des Organisme Génétiquement Modifié (OGM) et de leurs produits dérivés. Compte tenu de l'objectif poursuivi par les présentes règles, le matériel soumis à réglementation englobe tous les OGM (préparation d'ADN et d'Acide Ribonucléique (ARN), de cellules et organismes génétiquement modifiés ou développés), leurs produits dérivés ainsi que les déchets ou sous-produits issus de manipulation génétique (contenant des organismes viables ou autres). Ces règles comprennent quinze (15) chapitres : le premier traite des généralités ; le second traite des travaux en milieu confiné ; le troisième traite du déplacement des matériels soumis à réglementation ; le quatrième traite de l'expérimentation en champ des plantes transgéniques ; le cinquième traite de la diffusion/vulgarisation ; le sixième traite de l'utilisation directe pour l'alimentation humaine ou animale ou la transformation ; le septième traite de l’administration réglementaire et scientifique en matière de biosécurité ; le huitième traite de la mise sur le marché des OGM et leurs dérivés ; le neuvième traite des droits de propriété intellectuelle ; le dixième traite de l’engagement éthique du chercheur et du promoteur ; le onzième traite de la protection des personnels et de l’environnement en contact avec les OGM et produits dérivés ; le douzième traite de la responsabilité juridique ; le treizième traite des sanctions ; le quatorzième traite des dispositions particulières ; le quinzième enfin traite des dispositions transitoires.

Policy: Environmental Protection (Restriction on Use of Lead Shot) (Scotland) Regulations 2004 (S.S.I. No. 289 of 2004).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prohibit the use of lead shot for shooting with a shot gun on or over wetlands. Regulation 2 contains definitions of terms used. In regulation 3 "wetlands" is described by the Ramsar Convention on wetlands. Regulation 5 sets out powers to enable a constable to ascertain whether an offence has been committed under these Regulations. Regulation 6 places a duty on a constable to ensure, when leaving unoccupied land or land of which the owner is temporarily absent, which the constable has entered in exercise of the powers under regulation 5, that the land is effectively secured against unauthorised entry as the constable found it. Regulation 7 creates the offence of contravention of regulation 4. Regulation 8 provides for offences which are committed by bodies corporate, partnerships and unincorporated associations and extends liability to persons in control of such bodies in certain circumstances.

Policy: Ley Nº 1.356 - Regula la preservación del recurso aire y la prevención y control de la contaminación atmosférica.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto regular la materia de preservación del recurso aire así como prevenir y controlar la contaminación atmosférica. La misma se aplicará a todas las fuentes públicas o privadas capaces de producir contaminación atmosférica en el ámbito de la Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires. La contaminación atmosférica queda definida como la introducción directa o indirecta mediante la actividad humana de sustancias o energías en la atmósfera, que puedan tener efectos perjudiciales para la salud humana o calidad del ambiente, o que puedan causar daños a los bienes materiales o deteriorar o perjudicar el disfrute u otras utilizaciones legítimas del ambiente (art. 3). La Ley se compone de los siguientes títulos: (I) Objeto y ámbito de aplicación; (II) Disposiciones generales; (III) Estándares de calidad atmosférica y límites de emisión; (IV) De las fuentes fijas; (V) De las fuentes móviles libradas al tránsito; (VI) Del monitoreo y la vigilancia epidemiológica; (VII) De los planes de prevención y corrección de la contaminación atmosférica; (VIII) De los incentivos; (IX) De las convenciones y tratados internacionales; (X) De la Autoridad de Aplicación; (XI) De las infracciones; (XII) Cláusulas adicionales y transitorias.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Agricultural Societies Act (C.C.S.M. c. A30).
Policy_Content: The object of the Agricultural Societies Act is to promote improvement in agriculture, horticulture, arboriculture, manufactures, home economics, and the useful arts, by various activities set out in section 2. All former societies are continued, and the Act sets out stipulations when forming a new society in section 4. The following provisions set out the administrative procedures of running such a society, including; members (sect. 5); annual meetings (sect. 14) and Quorum (sect. 23). Section 25 provides for an advisory board to assist the superintendent by general direction and supervision of societies. The duties of the superintendent are outlined in section 28, and section 29 deals with annual returns. Societies are to be corporate bodies according to section 31. Section 32 deals with exhibitions in detail and Further sections provide the procedure in respect of grants. Provisions concerning the dissolution of a society can be found in section 45. At the conclusion of the act are two schedules concerning section 4, showing the prescribed form of an application for the formation of a society and an affidavit verifying the application.

Policy: Waste Management Licensing Amendment (Scotland) Regulations 2004 (S.S.I. No. 275 of 2004).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make miscellaneous changes to waste management legislation by amending the Environment Act 1995 (c.25) and the Waste Management Licensing Regulations 1994. Regulation 2 further amends the definition of "environmental licence”. Regulations 4 to 22 amend the 1994 Regulations. Regulation 4 broadens the scope of mobile plant prescriptions in regulation 12 of the 1994 Regulations. Regulations 6 to 8 amend regulations 17, 18 and 18A of, and Schedules 3 and 3A to, the 1994 Regulations, which relate to the requirement for registration of activities exempt from waste management licensing, as provided for in Article 11(2) of Directive 75/442/EEC on waste. Regulation 6 amends the list of paragraphs of Schedule 3 referred to in regulation 17(2) of the 1994 Regulations, which relate to the carrying out of the activities with the consent of the occupier of the land, to take account of the exempt activities set out in paragraphs 8, 12, 12A and 46 of that Schedule. Regulation 7 amends regulation 18 of the 1994 Regulations to: (a) take account of the further activities which may be registered as exempt activities, namely activities falling within paragraphs 8, 10, 12, 12A and 46 of Schedule 3 to the 1994 Regulations; (b) specify in relation to paragraph 46 the circumstances in which relevant particulars may be deemed to be entered in the register; (c) make further provision in certain circumstances for the refusal and/or removal of registration for those activities; and (d) impose fines on summary conviction for failure to register any of the exempt activities falling within those paragraphs. Regulation 8 amends regulation 18A of the 1994 Regulations. The registration obligations now extend to exempt activities falling within paragraphs 8, 10, 12, 12A and 46 of Schedule 3 to the 1994 Regulations and include obligations such as the keeping of appropriate records and the content of such records. Regulations 10 to 16 amend paragraphs 7 to 10, 12, 19, 30 of Schedule 3 to the 1994 Regulations. Regulation 10 further amends paragraph 7 of Schedule 3 to the 1994 Regulations to modify the list of wastes which can fall within the exempt activities and to provide for a 50 hectare restriction on the area of land covered by any one exemption. Regulation 11 replaces paragraph 8 of Schedule 3 to the 1994 Regulations to make provision for the storage and spreading of sludge on non-agricultural land if it results in ecological improvement or enhances the growth of certain crops. Regulation 13 replaces paragraph 10 of Schedule 3 to the 1994 Regulations to increase the quantities of sewage sludge which may be treated at a sewage treatment works in reliance on the exemption and to specify the list of wastes which can be used or stored, etc.

Policy: Decree No. 134/2004/ND-CP encouraging the development of rural industry.
Policy_Content: This Decree provides for the promotion, economical support and international participation to initiatives aimed at the improvement of the so called rural industrial production by mean of policies and financial interventions in the rural communities. Particularly, the activities that shall be supported, funded and encouraged shall be those related to the agricultural, forestry, fisheries and aquaculture industries; the construction of new facilities; the processing of new or raw materials and the production of goods destined to international trade; the production of hydro-electric power and the energy recycling. New facilities or old ones with a history of environmental pollution that must be levelled off and rebuilt according to the policies on environment protection shall be entitled to preferential land policies and fiscal exemptions.

Policy_Content: The Act aims to preserve and protect the country's forests. Policy: Ley de Desarrollo Forestal Sustentable del Estado de Durango.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece los principios y normas para fomentar el desarrollo forestal sustentable en el Estado de Durango. Al definir los principios que rigen la política forestal del Estado, la Ley promueve la coordinación entre los distintos órdenes de gobierno y la concertación con los sectores social y privado para lograr el desarrollo sustentable de los recursos forestales y sus asociados. En especial la Ley establece disposiciones para: impulsar la silvicultura y el aprovechamiento sustentable de los recursos forestales mediante el manejo integral y el concepto de cuencas hidrológicas, para asegurar los bienes y servicios suficientes y elevar la calidad de vida de los habitantes de los bosques y las zonas áridas; recuperar y fomentar el potencial productivo de los recursos forestales mediante las labores de protección, restauración y conservación, propiciar en la sociedad la cultura forestal, el desarrollo tecnológico y la investigación forestal; promover los bienes y servicios ambientales para contribuir a la fijación de carbono, la protección y conservación de los recursos hídricos y mantener la biodiversidad y belleza escénica de los ecosistemas forestales; estimular las certificaciones forestales y de bienes y servicios ambientales; prevenir y combatir los incendios forestales. La Ley reconoce el derecho de las comunidades indígenas al uso y disfrute de los recursos forestales de los lugares que ocupan y habitan.
